youtube.settings-page.to-create-a-key: To create your Youtube API key you need to create an app on Google Developer Console. You can find detailed instructions <1>here</1>.
youtube.settings-page.error-message: Unable to connect. Check your API key and try again.
youtube.feed-url-input.tooltip-label: Enter link to the YouTube profile, channel or a playlist.
youtube.feed-preview-table.title: Title
youtube.feed-url-description.url-types-descripti: <0>Channel/User</0> - loads all videos from the linked URL and let’s you sort order of appareance<2 /><3>Playlist</3> - loads a list of videos that are in the predefined order</1
youtube.feed-url-description.how-to-link-step-2: 2. Go to the <3>playlist</3>, <5>channel</5> or <5>user</5> you’d like to load in your app.
youtube.feed-url-description.how-to-link-step-3: 3. In the browser address bar, copy the URL.<1 />
youtube.feed-url-description.how-to-link-step-4: 4. Paste the URL in input field and press continue.
youtube.feed-sort-dropdown.sort-options-descript: <0>Relevance</0> – Resources are sorted based on their relevance. This is the default sort value.<2 /><0>Date</0> – Resources are sorted in reverse chronological order based on the date they were created.<2 /><0>Rating</0> – Resources are sorted from highest to lowest rating.<2 /><0>Title</0> – Resources are sorted alphabetically by title.<2 /><0>View count</0> – Resources are sorted from highest to lowest number of views.
